1.verse: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timotheus the brother,  to Philemon our beloved and fellow-worker,

2.verse: and Apphia the beloved, and Archippus our fellow-soldier,  and the assembly in thy house:

3.verse: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord  Jesus Christ!

4.verse: I give thanks to my God, always making mention of thee in my  prayers,

5.verse: hearing of thy love and faith that thou hast unto the Lord  Jesus and toward all the saints,

6.verse: that the fellowship of thy faith may become working in the  full knowledge of every good thing that [is] in you toward  Christ Jesus;

7.verse: for we have much joy and comfort in thy love, because the  bowels of the saints have been refreshed through thee,  brother.

8.verse: Wherefore, having in Christ much boldness to command thee  that which is fit --

9.verse: because of the love I rather entreat, being such an one as  Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ;

10.verse: I entreat thee concerning my child -- whom I did beget in  my bonds -- Onesimus,

11.verse: who once was to thee unprofitable, and now is profitable to  me and to thee,

12.verse: whom I did send again, and thou him (that is, my own  bowels) receive,

13.verse: whom I did wish to retain to myself, that in thy behalf he  might minister to me in the bonds of the good news,

14.verse: and apart from thy mind I willed to do nothing, that as of  necessity thy good deed may not be, but of willingness,

15.verse: for perhaps because of this he did depart for an hour, that  age-duringly thou mayest have him,

16.verse: no more as a servant, but above a servant -- a brother  beloved, especially to me, and how much more to thee, both in  the flesh and in the Lord!

17.verse: If, then, with me thou hast fellowship, receive him as me,

18.verse: and if he did hurt to thee, or doth owe anything, this to  me be reckoning;

19.verse: I, Paul did write with my hand, I -- I will repay; that I  may not say that also thyself, besides, to me thou dost owe.

20.verse: Yes, brother, may I have profit of thee in the Lord;  refresh my bowels in the Lord;

21.verse: having been confident in thy obedience I did write to thee,  having known that also above what I may say thou wilt do;

22.verse: and at the same time also prepare for me a lodging, for I  hope that through your prayers I shall be granted to you.

23.verse: Salute thee doth Epaphras, (my fellow-captive in Christ  Jesus,)

24.verse: Markus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lukas, my fellow-workmen!

25.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [is] with your spirit!  Amen.
